content: HOTELICOPTER! It's been all over the news and the internet for the past week, but it's a total fraud, an April Fools joke which swept the world. Somebody crafted a beautifully done promo and a website to support the joke. Frankly, I nearly swallowed it! Announcing the world’s first flying hotel! The Hotelicopter features 18 luxuriously-appointed rooms for adrenaline junkies seeking a truly unique and memorable travel experience. Each soundproofed room is equipped with a queen-sized bed, fine linens, a mini-bar, coffee machine, wireless internet access, and all the luxurious appointments you’d expect from a flying five star hotel. The Hotelicopter is modeled on the Soviet-made Mil V-12, of which there were only two prototypes ever made. The Hotelicopter Company purchased one of these prototypes from the Mikhail Leontyevich Mil helicopter plant in Panki-Tomilino, Russia in 2004 and have been engineering the world's first flying hotel ever since. The Hotelicopter is due to fly maiden journey this summer(June 26, 2009) with an undisclosed price... Inaugural Summer Tour - 14 days (Friday June 26, 2009 to Friday July 10, 2009) California Tour - 14 days (Friday July 17, 2009 to Friday July 24, 2009) Bay/Jamaica, European Tour - 16 days (Friday July 31, 2009 to Sunday August 16, 2009) "www.hotelicopter.com" "http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s7UJ66u941g"

title: How many of you fell for this one?

content: Honestly, this was the first time Iheard about it. I think anyone would have fallen for it, especially if it was running before Arpil 1, which kind of defeats it being an April fools joke. IMO. Todays politics remind me of an old saying. - "Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas?" - Joseph Stalin

title: How many of you fell for this one?

content: hhhmmm.. in this context, it is pretty hard to believe. seeing how the MI 12 was about the size of a dc-9, it would be believable, but the fuel consumption rate, fully loaded would be hellatious. that, and the inflexible rotorblades on the bird would make for a VERY tough ride with easy left turns, but straned right turns. i'd say it would be hard to sleep with the WHUMP WHUMP of the bird bouncing every time the blades made a full turn.
